boat.name: Shireen
boat.full_description:
On 12 May, 2017, 'Shireen', the restored 19/24 class Clyde racing yacht was relaunched at Holy Loch Marina, Sandbank.

Based on records kept by a previous owner, the Yachting Life article summarises some of her early history. She appears in the 19/24 class book in 1932, owned by a Mr Lawson who won the Royal Gourock Yacht Club Cup that year. During the Second World War, she was kept on Inchmurrin, Loch Lomond. She was used to transport animals and deliver the mail, with fuel being in short supply.

Since then she has had a chequered history and spent some time lying in the open which led to the need for some major repairs done by Ronnie McGrouther of McKellars slipway.
boat.construction_details: Carvel Mahogany and Pitch pine on oak frames
boat.short_description: 'Shireen' is a Clyde 19/24, built in 1900 in the Royal Burgh of Rutherglen by Ewing McGruer. Designed by Alfred Mylne she has been restored and relaunched, May 2017.

for_sales.sales_text:
Gaff sloop Clyde Class 19/24, designed by Mylne, built by McGruer in 1900, this historically important little old gaffer was virtually rebuilt from the keel up. Yanmar 1GM10 engine. Sleeps two, new full cockpit enclosure and sail cover. Sails virtually unused, furler on genoa. 19ft w/line 24ft overall. 2017 survey available.

In commission, Scotland. May consider exchange for classic car.
